availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Humphrey Mooar (Kenton County, KY, attorney and judge)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Hollis, New Hampshire, native. Son of Gardner Mooar and Mary Hardy Marden Mooar. Married to Phoebe Cordelia Flagg Mooar on June 17,1852. Father of Charles Mooar, Sarah Mooar, Mary Mooar, and Evie Mooar. Taught school in Louisiana 1848 to 1849. Studied law with Morehead in 1849. Employed by Daniel Mooar as an attorney in Kenton County in 1850. Judge of the Kenton County Court from 1858 to 1862. Attorney in Kenton County in 1860. Employed Mary Walker as a servant in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 149B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 5, p. 756.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 132B
Find A Grave, "Charles H. Mooar (1822-1898)," Memorial #78718313, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/78718313 (accessed December 2, 2019).
Dartmouth Necrology 1898-99, pp. 16-17 (accessed through Google Books on May 23, 2017).
